result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Antwuan M Scott

records.addlTxt:
9:25 AM Prosecuting attorney Jack A. Pitzo in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Antwuan M Scott in court, in custody.  Attorney Jeffrey W. Jensen Jr. in court for Antwuan M Scott.  City of Brookfield Police Department Lieutenant Antonio Hudson sworn in and testifies on direct by Attorney Pitzo.  Cross examination by Attorney Jensen.  State rests.  State moves for bind over without argument.  Attorney Jensen objects to bind over without argument.  Court finds probable cause to believe that a felony was committed and binds the defendant over for trial.  Waive reading of Information.  NOT GUILTY PLEA ENTERED.  Bail remains as fixed.
Hearing scheduled for November 7, 2022 at 09:00 am.
Defendant's Demand for Discovery and Inspection.
records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Defendant

records.addlTxt: Preliminary hearing on August 12, 2022 at 09:15 am.

02:48 PM Defendant Antwuan M Scott in court, in custody, with attorney Jeffrey W. Jensen.    District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

The Court calls the matter for Status of Counsel.
Defendant is eligible for State Public Defender representation.  An attorney will be appointed.
Preliminary Hearing requested.  Preliminary time limits waived.
Bail remains as fixed.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for August 12, 2022 at 09:15 am.

Defendant to comply with I.D. Processing.  Absolute sobriety, defendant is not to possess or consume any alcohol.  Defendant is not to use/possess any controlled substances without a valid prescription and take as prescribed.  Defendant not to possess any drug paraphernalia.  Defendant is not to possess any dangerous weapons/firearms/knives.

ADDRESS INFO for Antwuan M Scott
Current: 515 W Moreland Blvd, c/o Waukesha County Jail, Waukesha, WI 53188 United States  (Effective: 07-15-2022)
Prior: 4666 N. 66th Street, Milwaukee, WI 53218

02:07 PM Defendant Antwuan M Scott in court, in custody, with attorney Luis Daniel Gutierrez.   Attorney appears as friend of the court.   District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant was not evaluated by the public defender's office, as he was booked on a parole violation and then came in as new charges.  Defense acknowledges receipt of complaint and waives reading of complaint.  Service admitted/advised of charges and potential penalties.  Court advises of right to an attorney.  Defendant is currently on a probation and parole hold.  Public Defenders Office to evaluate the defendant prior to the next date.  Court tolled time limits for preliminary hearing.  Hearing scheduled for July 19, 2022 at 01:00 pm.
State's Demand for Discovery and Inspection and Notice of Intent to Use Defendant's Statement and DNA Evidence.
